isis.stitle: ELECTRICAL SYSTEM TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE - 9200, 9300, 9400 Models Built After January 1, 1995 - ELECTRICAL TROUBLESHOOTING LIGHT SYSTEMS - OPERATION - HEADLIGHTS ON 9200 AND 9400

svcproc.title: HEADLIGHTS ON 9200 AND 9400
svcproc.para: The 9200 and 9400 model trucks utilize a two headlight system, one on each side. The lamps receive power in the low beam mode on circuit 53B with the power split up on 53C for the right lamp and 53D for the left lamp. The lamps receive power in the high beam mode from circuit 52F, with power split up on 52E for the right lamp and 52D for the left lamp.
Circuits 52-GD and 52-GA provide the ground path for the left headlight to J7 cab ground. Circuits 52-GE, 52-GF, and 11-GF provide the ground path for the right headlight.

note.para: With Canadian DRL circuit 52-GE becomes a power feed from 66J to the headlamps in series through the ground of the left headlight.
